TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AuthorizationRule extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement

Docs.summary: The class allows you to programmatically access and modify the section of a configuration file. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule> class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the `authorization` section of a configuration file.
This type is part of a group that includes the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationSection>, the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRuleCollection>, and the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRuleAction> types.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationSection> can update the configuration information at any level in the configuration hierarchy.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule>.
> [!NOTE] > If you use the `credentials` section, be sure to follow the guidelines explained at [ASP.NET Authentication](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/fc10b0ef-4ce4-4a7f-9174-886325221ee1). For scalability and better security capability, it is recommended that you use an external database to store users' credentials. For more information about building secure ASP.NET applications, search the Microsoft MSDN Web site (msdn.microsoft.com) for "Securing Your ASP.NET Application" and "Building Secure ASP.NET Applications: Authentication, Authorization, and Secure Communication."

Docs.param: The object to use to initialize the new instance.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class using the passed object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule.%23ctor%2A> constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system.

## Remarks At run time, the authorization module iterates through `allow` and `deny` elements until it finds the first access rule that fits a particular user. It then grants or denies access to a URL resource depending on whether the first access rule found is `allow` or `deny`. Access is allowed by default.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use this property.

Docs.summary: Gets the roles associated with the resource.
Docs.value: A collection containing the roles whose authorization must be verified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule.Roles%2A> property is a list of roles that are granted or denied access to the resource. There must be at least one value in either the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule.Users%2A> property collection or the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule.Roles%2A> property collection, or both.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use this property.

Docs.summary: Gets the users associated with the resource.
Docs.value: A collection containing the users whose authorization must be verified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule.Users%2A> property is a list of users that are granted or denied access to the resource. There must be at least one value in either the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule.Users%2A> property collection or the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule.Roles%2A> property collection, or both.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use this property.

Docs.summary: Gets the verbs associated with the resource.
Docs.value: A collection containing the verbs whose authorization must be verified.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.AuthorizationRule.Verbs%2A> property is a comma-separated list of HTTP transmission methods that are granted or denied access to the resource.
## Examples The following code example shows how to access this property.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.Authorization#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.Authorization/CS/authorization.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.Authorization#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.Authorization/VB/authorization.vb#6)]
